CatDescriptText: Portion of article for related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 25, 1946. pg. 9. reads: "Miss Frenchie Hughes Weds Thomas Richardson - Miss Frenchie Odessa Hughes, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. J. Oscar Hughes, became the bride of Thomas Harold Richardson, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Richardson, in a ceremony performed recently at 7214 Monticello Street by the Rev. R. T. Twiggs of Monumental Baptist Church. The bride, given in marriage by her father, wore turquoise blue with a matching hat and fingertip veil.  She carried a white prayer book with a corsage of orchids.  Bridesmaid wears blue.  Miss Charlotte Hall of Cleveland, Ohio, was maid of honor.  She wore sky blue with white gardenias.  John Richardson, brother of the groom was best man..."
TitMainTitle: J.O. Hughes presenting wrapped frame to bride Frenchie Hughes Richardson and groom Thomas Richardson, with Lottie Robinson or Charlotte Hall looking on, standing in home at 7214 Monticello Street, Homewood
